intro: Dipanax mannii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces showy, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
